description: The cause identified in this scenario relates to the incorrect manipulation of partition types during the manual steps for enhancing Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) on Server 2022 Core. Specifically, the instruction to create a primary partition with 'id=27' is crucial because WinRE scans for this partition type during re-enablement. However, following the instruction to format this partition clobbers its original type and resets it to default. Consequently, when attempting to re-enable WinRE, the system fails to recognize the partition as suitable, leading it to create a new recovery partition on the C: drive instead. Additionally, on Server 2022 Core, even having the correct partition setup becomes futile, as the requisite patch cannot be directly installed without modifications to registry settings. Therefore, careful adherence to partition configurations is essential for successful WinRE implementation on affected systems.
